sentences: Noah rakensi arkin pelastaakseen eläimet tulvasta.
He säilyttävät vanhoja asiakirjoja arkistossa, joka on täynnä arkkeja.
context: The Finnish word 'arkki' means 'sheet', often referring to a sheet of paper. It can also refer to Noah’s Ark or the Ark of the Covenant, historical and religious objects. The word declines based on case; for example, 'arkin' is the genitive form meaning 'of the sheet'.  The plural form is 'arkit'. You can see the suffix '-i' added to indicate plurality.
